data.title: State Historical Society
data.text:
Title: Adjutant General. North Dakota National Guard, Records

Dates: ca. 1883-2011

Record Series: 32348

Quantity: Approximately 220 feet (includes oversized)

Abstract: Contains financial records, reports, rosters, registers, scrapbooks, newspaper clippings, photographs, photographic slides, 16mm film, VHS videotapes. The series has been kept in the original organization as presented by the North Dakota National Guard.

Restriction: Much of the contents of the series is restricted due to the presence of social security numbers, medical records, and other confidential information. The restricted records are not listed in this inventory.

Copyright: Public records are not subject to copyright restrictions, although record series may contain copyrighted material. Consideration of such copyrights is the responsibility of the author and publisher.

Access: These records are available for public inspection under provision of the North Dakota Century Code, 55-02.1-08.

Citation: Researchers are requested to cite the record group, series name and number, and the State Historical Society of North Dakota in all footnote and bibliographic references.

SERIES DESCRIPTION

Upon arrival at the State Historical Society of North Dakota, the records were already in series designated by the North Dakota National Guard. These series were kept by the State Historical Society of North Dakota. The records are in twenty series: Finance, Personnel, Legal, Operations, Logistics, Intelligence, 164th Association, Miscellaneous, Spanish American War/Philippine Insurrection, Mexican Border Incident, World War I, World War II, Korean War, Berlin Crisis, Desert Storm, Operations Joint Endeavor/Guardian, Operations Noble Eagle/Enduring Freedom/Iraqi Freedom, National Guard Association of North Dakota, Administration, Photos, News clippings, and Audiovisual Material.

SERIES I. Finances, 1903-1989, Boxes 1-32

Series I consists of financial records of the North Dakota National Guard and the National Guard Association of North Dakota. Records include bank statements, cancelled checks, vouchers, insurance information, pay and allowances, and land lease information.

SERIES II. Personnel, ca. 1898-1984, Boxes 32-64

Series II consists of records regarding the personnel of the North Dakota National Guard. Records include correspondence, records regarding the North Dakota Home Guard, discharge papers, handbooks, plans for personnel, enlistment records, and miscellaneous papers regarding personnel of the North Dakota National Guard.

SERIES III. Legal, 1948-1975, Boxes 64-65

Series III consists of records regarding legal and legislative action pertaining to the North Dakota National Guard.

SERIES IV. Operations, 1901-1982, Boxes 65-68

Series IV consists of records regarding the operations of the North Dakota National Guard. Records include information regarding presidential visits, commemorations of wars, dedications, permanent files, bands, histories of the North Dakota National Guard and other various operational files.

SERIES V. Logistics, 1898-1981, Boxes 68-70

Series V includes records like field returns, monthly returns, report cards, miscellaneous reports, supply lists, mobilization files, and records regarding the 31st Engineer Battalion of the North Dakota National Guard.

SERIES VI. Intelligence, 1900-1982, Boxes 70-113

Series VI consists of various reports such as morning reports and monthly reports. It also includes records regarding discharges, special orders, company orders, causalities, women in service, historical requests, muster rolls, correspondence, personnel rosters, memos, oaths of offices, and journals from the times spanning World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War.

SERIES VII. 164th Association, 1957-1992, Boxes 113-114

Series VII consists of records regarding the 164th Association. Records include information on Guadalcanal, reunions, rosters, correspondence, and mailing lists.

SERIES VIII. Miscellaneous, 1957-2000, Box 114

Series VIII consists of miscellaneous records such as history of the North Dakota National Guard, the Roughrider Award of North Dakota, parades, and other miscellaneous topics.

SERIES IX. Spanish American War/Philippine Insurrection, ca. 1997-1998, Box 114

Series IX contains records pertaining to the 100th anniversary of the Spanish American War/Philippine Insurrection.

SERIES X. Mexican Border Incident

Series X records reside with the North Dakota National Guard.

SERIES XI. World War I

Series XI records reside with the North Dakota National Guard.

SERIES XII. World War II, 1994-1996, Box 114

Series XII consists of a folder containing information on the WWII Commemorative Parade.

SERIES XIII. Korean War, 1952, Box 114

Series XIII consists of one folder regarding the Korean War Report of Mobilization.

SERIES XIV. Berlin Crisis

Series XIV records reside with the North Dakota National Guard.

SERIES XV. Desert Storm, 1990-1992, Box 114

Series XV consists of records on Desert Storm. Records include memos, video information, orders, personnel lists, and news releases.

SERIES XVI. Operations Joint Endeavor/Guardian, 1996-1997, Boxes 114-115

Series XVI contains records including press releases and mobilization operations of the 129th during Operations Joint Endeavor/Guardian.

SERIES XVII. Operations Noble Eagle/Enduring Freedom/Iraqi Freedom

Series XVII records reside with the North Dakota National Guard.

SERIES XVIII. National Guard Association of North Dakota, 1996, Box 115

Series XVIII contains on the National Guard Association of North Dakota officers and directors.

SERIES XIX. Administration, 1996, Box 115

Series XIX consists of records of the recognition ceremony of retired personnel.

SERIES XX. Photographs, ca. 1885-1997, Boxes 130-185 and Oversized

Series XX consists of photographs of various trainings, deployments, and members of the North Dakota National Guard. Photographs are organized by size.

SERIES XXI. News Clippings, 1924-1981, Oversized

Series XXI contains newspaper clippings in oversized bound scrapbooks.

SERIES XXII. Moving Image, ca. 1915-2008, Boxes 186-233

Series XXII consists of 16mm film, ¾” videotapes, VHS tapes, DVCPro, DVCam, and 8mm videotapes of training videos, training at Camp Grafton (N.D.), PSAs, commercials, deployments, and histories of the National Guard. Moving image remains in original organization as transferred to the State Archives by the North DaKota National Guard, roughly by type of media.
